name: fairy battle

attributes.attribute: engage in rough and sometimes risky play
traveling across the land to do night battle
carry their wounded home at dawn
found on bushes in the early morning
believed to be the fairies’ blood

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Folktales often depict battles between fairies. These supernatural beings were believed to be immortal and viewed battles as enjoyable games, much like the way we might view sporting events. In Ireland, fairies from different regions would engage in contests, similar to modern-day hurling matches. They would travel to battle at night and return the wounded back to their homes at dawn. These battles were so intense that it was believed that the phlegm-like substances found on bushes in the mornings were remnants of the fairies' blood, constantly spilled during their never-ending battles.
